intro: Calycogonium susannae, commonly known as the Annaliese's ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, translucent, and ephemeral blooms that appear only under specific environmental conditions. The plant's botanical features include delicate, spiral-shaped leaves and a short, unbranched stem. Its flowers, which are pollinated by specific nocturnal insects, emit a faint bioluminescent glow at night. Due to its extreme habitat requirements, it is considered critically endangered and is the subject of ongoing botanical research.
